values.title: File processing error handling should print line number

content.raw:
Original [issue 2](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=2) created by ericr86 on 2010-08-27T18:50:00.000Z:

When processing input files (such as BED, GFF, or GTF inputs), if an error occurs Segtools will print the offending line along with an error message. For diagnostics, it would be useful to have the line number printed as well.
content.html:
Original [issue 2](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=2) created by ericr86 on 2010-08-27T18:50:00.000Z:

When processing input files (such as BED, GFF, or GTF inputs), if an error occurs Segtools will print the offending line along with an error message. For diagnostics, it would be useful to have the line number printed as well.

values.title: Make aggregating by groups the default behavior

content.html:
Original [issue 3](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=3) created by ericr86 on 2010-08-27T18:53:37.000Z:

From Bill:

"It's somewhat perverse to have the default behavior be to ignore the labels. Maybe consider having the default be equivalent to the current --groups option, and have some option (--ignore-labels) to get the current default behavior."

values.title: Documentation does not display command arguments

content.raw:
Original [issue 4](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=4) created by ericr86 on 2010-08-27T18:56:40.000Z:

The Segtools documentation does not list the required arguments for each command. Instead, a user must run the command with --help to find out these arguments. This is inconvenient and should be changed immediately.
content.html:
Original [issue 4](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=4) created by ericr86 on 2010-08-27T18:56:40.000Z:

The Segtools documentation does not list the required arguments for each command. Instead, a user must run the command with --help to find out these arguments. This is inconvenient and should be changed immediately.

values.title: Change name of HTML file produced by segtools

content.raw:
Original [issue 8](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=8) created by ericr86 on 2010-08-27T19:26:04.000Z:

I don't think the html file created by segtools should be named index.html.  This prevents the user from browsing the directory directly through a web browser.  I suggest something like "segtools-report.html".  Also, the naming should be documented, and there should probably be an option to specify an alternate name if the user so desires.
content.html:
Original [issue 8](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=8) created by ericr86 on 2010-08-27T19:26:04.000Z:

I don't think the html file created by segtools should be named index.html. This prevents the user from browsing the directory directly through a web browser. I suggest something like "segtools-report.html". Also, the naming should be documented, and there should probably be an option to specify an alternate name if the user so desires.

values.title: Signal-distribution assumes signal values are integers

content.raw:
Original [issue 9](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=9) created by ericr86 on 2010-08-31T00:40:53.000Z:

The signal distribution analyses assume that binning the signal on integers is reasonable. This is not the case for signal data that varies less than 1.0, such as GC content. At least one offending section is in signal_distribution.py:

        max_bins = ceil(genome.maxs).astype(int)
        min_bins = floor(genome.mins).astype(int)
        # A dict from tracks to a range tuple
        track_ranges = dict(zip(tracks, zip(min_bins, max_bins)))
	...
	bins=xrange(min_bin, max_bin + 1)
content.html:
Original [issue 9](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=9) created by ericr86 on 2010-08-31T00:40:53.000Z:

The signal distribution analyses assume that binning the signal on integers is reasonable. This is not the case for signal data that varies less than 1.0, such as GC content. At least one offending section is in signal_distribution.py:

max_bins = ceil(genome.maxs).astype(int) min_bins = floor(genome.mins).astype(int)

  1. A dict from tracks to a range tuple track_ranges = dict(zip(tracks, zip(min_bins, max_bins))) ... bins=xrange(min_bin, max_bin + 1)

values.title: Parsing failure for blank lines in a BED file

content.raw:
Original [issue 11](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=11) created by ericr86 on 2010-09-03T15:56:31.000Z:

If provided with a segmentation containing a blank line, segtools dies with this error message:

    if words[0] == "track":  # Ignore any track lines
IndexError: list index out of range


It should instead say something like "Input file foo.bed is misformatted at line 478.  The line is blank."
content.html:
Original [issue 11](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=11) created by ericr86 on 2010-09-03T15:56:31.000Z:

If provided with a segmentation containing a blank line, segtools dies with this error message:

if words[0] == "track": # Ignore any track lines IndexError: list index out of range

It should instead say something like "Input file foo.bed is misformatted at line 478. The line is blank."

values.title: Signal-distribution "# data points read from segmentation tracks" is confusing

content.raw:
Original [issue 12](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=12) created by ericr86 on 2010-09-03T17:32:28.000Z:

This is easily misinterpreted as printing the number of data points read, and it is not clear that this is only those within tracks specified as segmentation tracks in the segmentation track line.

This should probably be changed to:
1) print the total number of data points read first.
2) if the number of data points read from segmentation tracks is printed at all, if it is zero, "Segmentation tracks unspecified" or something like that should be printed instead of just the "0".
content.html:
Original [issue 12](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=12) created by ericr86 on 2010-09-03T17:32:28.000Z:

This is easily misinterpreted as printing the number of data points read, and it is not clear that this is only those within tracks specified as segmentation tracks in the segmentation track line.

This should probably be changed to: 1) print the total number of data points read first. 2) if the number of data points read from segmentation tracks is printed at all, if it is zero, "Segmentation tracks unspecified" or something like that should be printed instead of just the "0".

Currently the HTML .div file describes in some detail the color scale and z-axis of the signal-distribution stats plot. Unfortunately, this information is not also included in the documentation, which is should be.

values.title: signal-distribution reference to "normalization" is actually "standardization"

content.raw:
Original [issue 14](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=14) created by ericr86 on 2010-09-03T17:36:06.000Z:

Source and documentation references to row-normalization of the mean values in the signal-distribution heatmap should be changed to row-standardization, since the transformation makes the mean 0 and variance 1, rather than sum 1.
content.html:
Original [issue 14](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=14) created by ericr86 on 2010-09-03T17:36:06.000Z:

Source and documentation references to row-normalization of the mean values in the signal-distribution heatmap should be changed to row-standardization, since the transformation makes the mean 0 and variance 1, rather than sum 1.

values.title: signal-distribution should have --row-standardize flag

content.raw:
Original [issue 15](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=15) created by ericr86 on 2010-09-03T17:38:01.000Z:

It would be more useful if the signal-distribution command provided row-standardization as an option, rather than doing it all the time. This way, when there are only one or two labels, the code wouldn't break by default.
content.html:
Original [issue 15](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=15) created by ericr86 on 2010-09-03T17:38:01.000Z:

It would be more useful if the signal-distribution command provided row-standardization as an option, rather than doing it all the time. This way, when there are only one or two labels, the code wouldn't break by default.

values.title: Single simple font-size option to command line calls

content.raw:
Original [issue 16](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=16) created by ericr86 on 2010-09-14T14:32:32.000Z:

It would be useful if there were a way to control the font size in the Segtools plots directly from the command line in a simple, useful way. Currently, the font sizes are sporadic and not always appropriate for given plots.

It would be useful if there were a way to control the font size in the Segtools plots directly from the command line in a simple, useful way. Currently, the font sizes are sporadic and not always appropriate for given plots.

values.title: Segtools header should report the number of labels

content.html:
Original [issue 17](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=17) created by ericr86 on 2010-10-01T18:11:36.000Z:

The "Segmentation information" section of the report should include a line that says, e.g.,

"Number of labels: 13"

It would probably also be worthwhile to say

"Number of segments: 1,354,801"

And, if it's not too hard to do

"Number of bases: 3,142,512,251"

values.title: Error in signal-distribution standard deviation calculation

content.raw:
Original [issue 18](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=18) created by ericr86 on 2011-01-12T16:19:55.000Z:

I noticed after running segtools-signal-distribution (v1.1.2) on a segway segmentation in linux, in the file signal_distribution.stats.tab, the calculated standard deviation was very strongly dependent on the mean through a non-linear function. 

Using the file segtools_distribution.tab, I found that the calculated mean was correct, but the standard deviations were incorrect. 

I tracked this down to line 352 in signal_distribution.py, where I believe that edges[:1] is used (which always evaluates to 0) instead of edges[:-1] (as in the mean calculation). 
Also, this formula (when corrected) appears to calculate the sample variance instead of the sample standard deviation (which requires the square root).


 As an additional comment, I have previously  found it useful to transform the signal data using a logarithmic or asinh function, so that the distribution is more normal. Could this be included as an option, as it might alter the clustering of the states?
content.html:
Original [issue 18](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=18) created by ericr86 on 2011-01-12T16:19:55.000Z:

I noticed after running segtools-signal-distribution (v1.1.2) on a segway segmentation in linux, in the file signal_distribution.stats.tab, the calculated standard deviation was very strongly dependent on the mean through a non-linear function.

Using the file segtools_distribution.tab, I found that the calculated mean was correct, but the standard deviations were incorrect.

I tracked this down to line 352 in signal_distribution.py, where I believe that edges[:1] is used (which always evaluates to 0) instead of edges[:-1] (as in the mean calculation). Also, this formula (when corrected) appears to calculate the sample variance instead of the sample standard deviation (which requires the square root).

As an additional comment, I have previously found it useful to transform the signal data using a logarithmic or asinh function, so that the distribution is more normal. Could this be included as an option, as it might alter the clustering of the states?

values.title: Using fully-qualified path names with -o leads to HTML files that don't work

content.raw:
Original [issue 19](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=19) created by ericr86 on 2011-02-04T23:11:01.000Z:

They won't work because they, too, will contain the fully-qualified path name, which probably does not correspond to the HTTP server's layout.
content.html:
Original [issue 19](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=19) created by ericr86 on 2011-02-04T23:11:01.000Z:

They won't work because they, too, will contain the fully-qualified path name, which probably does not correspond to the HTTP server's layout.

values.title: signal-distribution should split into more granular parts

content.raw:
Original [issue 20](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=20) created by ericr86 on 2011-02-09T22:34:45.000Z:

For example, chr1 is too big. Splitting by supercontigs would help. Or even by windows within those supercontigs.
 
Also, having a more convenient interface to generate all these commands and run them would be nice.
content.html:
Original [issue 20](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=20) created by ericr86 on 2011-02-09T22:34:45.000Z:

For example, chr1 is too big. Splitting by supercontigs would help. Or even by windows within those supercontigs.

Also, having a more convenient interface to generate all these commands and run them would be nice.

values.title: Test suite needs updating?

content.raw:
Original [issue 21](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=21) created by ericr86 on 2011-04-13T17:18:57.000Z:

Just installed segway 1.0.3, genomedata 1.2.2 and segtools 1.1.6.

Get the following error running the segtools test suite; apparently segtools.bed_compare was deprecated at some point??? and the test not updated.

root@domU-12-31-39-07-1E-71:/segway-build/src/segtools-1.1.6/test# ./run_all.py 
Found test modules: ['test_bed_compare', 'test_overlap', 'test_feature_distance']
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./run_all.py", line 34, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "./run_all.py", line 25, in main
    suite = unittest.defaultTestLoader.loadTestsFromNames(modulenames)
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/unittest.py", line 613, in loadTestsFromNames
    suites = [self.loadTestsFromName(name, module) for name in names]
  File "/usr/lib/python2.6/unittest.py", line 576, in loadTestsFromName
    module = __import__('.'.join(parts_copy))
  File "/segway-build/src/segtools-1.1.6/test/test_bed_compare.py", line 11, in <module>
    from segtools.bed_compare import edit_distance
ImportError: No module named bed_compare
content.html:
Original [issue 21](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=21) created by ericr86 on 2011-04-13T17:18:57.000Z:

Just installed segway 1.0.3, genomedata 1.2.2 and segtools 1.1.6.

Get the following error running the segtools test suite; apparently segtools.bed_compare was deprecated at some point??? and the test not updated.

root@domU-12-31-39-07-1E-71:/segway-build/src/segtools-1.1.6/test# ./run_all.py Found test modules: ['test_bed_compare', 'test_overlap', 'test_feature_distance'] Traceback (most recent call last): File "./run_all.py", line 34, in <module> sys.exit(main()) File "./run_all.py", line 25, in main suite = unittest.defaultTestLoader.loadTestsFromNames(modulenames) File "/usr/lib/python2.6/unittest.py", line 613, in loadTestsFromNames suites = [self.loadTestsFromName(name, module) for name in names] File "/usr/lib/python2.6/unittest.py", line 576, in loadTestsFromName module = import('.'.join(parts_copy)) File "/segway-build/src/segtools-1.1.6/test/test_bed_compare.py", line 11, in <module> from segtools.bed_compare import edit_distance ImportError: No module named bed_compare

values.title: Identify requires params/input.master present in identifydir

content.raw:
Original [issue 22](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=22) created by ericr86 on 2011-05-04T15:33:13.000Z:

Using version 1.0.2 after training, segway identify genomedata traindir identifydir failed with error 

IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: path('identifydirname/params/input.master')

Copying the file from the traindir fixes the issue.
content.html:
Original [issue 22](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=22) created by ericr86 on 2011-05-04T15:33:13.000Z:

Using version 1.0.2 after training, segway identify genomedata traindir identifydir failed with error

IOError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: path('identifydirname/params/input.master')

Copying the file from the traindir fixes the issue.

values.title: R png() require X11 and fail in queued jobs

content.raw:
Original [issue 23](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=23) created by ericr86 on 2011-05-07T19:32:59.000Z:

Because the R png() function requires an active X11 session, png() calls in segtools jobs run on schedulers fail.  From perusing the internet, a common alternative is the CairoPNG function available in the R Cairo package, which is mostly a drop-in replacement and does not require an active X11 session.  Or is there a workaround to forward an X11 connection to a running job?

From an LSF job:

Loading <class 'segtools.Segmentation'>:
  Checking for overlapping segments... done
Saving tab file... done
Saving tab file... done
Saving plots with R function: 'save.length'...Error creating image: PK23.pos/identify/length_distribution/length_distribution.png. Error message: unable to start device PNG
Error creating image: PK23.pos/identify/length_distribution/length_distribution.slide.png. Error message: unable to start device PNG
Error creating image: PK23.pos/identify/length_distribution/length_distribution.thumb.png. Error message: unable to start device PNG
Warning messages:
1: In device(filepath, ...) : unable to open connection to X11 display ''
2: In device(filepath, ...) : unable to open connection to X11 display ''
content.html:
Original issue 23 created by ericr86 on 2011-05-07T19:32:59.000Z:

Because the R png() function requires an active X11 session, png() calls in segtools jobs run on schedulers fail. From perusing the internet, a common alternative is the CairoPNG function available in the R Cairo package, which is mostly a drop-in replacement and does not require an active X11 session. Or is there a workaround to forward an X11 connection to a running job?

From an LSF job:

Loading <class 'segtools.Segmentation'>: Checking for overlapping segments... done Saving tab file... done Saving tab file... done Saving plots with R function: 'save.length'...Error creating image: PK23.pos/identify/length_distribution/length_distribution.png. Error message: unable to start device PNG Error creating image: PK23.pos/identify/length_distribution/length_distribution.slide.png. Error message: unable to start device PNG Error creating image: PK23.pos/identify/length_distribution/length_distribution.thumb.png. Error message: unable to start device PNG Warning messages: 1: In device(filepath, ...) : unable to open connection to X11 display '' 2: In device(filepath, ...) : unable to open connection to X11 display ''

values.title: R error: "nlabels not found" in version 1.1.9

content.raw:
Original [issue 24](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=24) created by ericr86 on 2012-01-10T16:33:36.000Z:

Running segtools-gmtk-parameters, version 1.1.9, results in the error : object 'nlabels' not found.

The error is in the definition of the function save.track.stats in track_statistics.R, line 631. 

Restoring the definition from segtools version 1.1.7, corrects the issue, as nlabels and ntracks are defined within the function.
content.html:
Original issue 24 created by ericr86 on 2012-01-10T16:33:36.000Z:

Running segtools-gmtk-parameters, version 1.1.9, results in the error : object 'nlabels' not found.

The error is in the definition of the function save.track.stats in track_statistics.R, line 631.

Restoring the definition from segtools version 1.1.7, corrects the issue, as nlabels and ntracks are defined within the function.

values.title: segtools-signal-distribution reporting statistics for wrong labels

content.raw:
Original [issue 25](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=25) created by ericr86 on 2012-01-19T11:43:54.000Z:

In segtools version 1.1.9, the segment labels are being shuffled in segtools-signal distribution, both in the tab file and the resulting plots. This occurs with or without the use of a mnemonics file.

It appears that the labels are assigned based on which appear first in the segmentation file, i.e. the first segment label in the segmentation is relabelled either 0 (if no mnemonics) or to the label 0 is mapped to in the mnemonic file.

The issue appears to arise in signal_distribution.py, line 69, labels = segmentation.labels.
content.html:
Original issue 25 created by ericr86 on 2012-01-19T11:43:54.000Z:

In segtools version 1.1.9, the segment labels are being shuffled in segtools-signal distribution, both in the tab file and the resulting plots. This occurs with or without the use of a mnemonics file.

It appears that the labels are assigned based on which appear first in the segmentation file, i.e. the first segment label in the segmentation is relabelled either 0 (if no mnemonics) or to the label 0 is mapped to in the mnemonic file.

The issue appears to arise in signal_distribution.py, line 69, labels = segmentation.labels.

values.title: segtools-aggregation fails in gene mode when annotation is preprocessed

content.raw:
Original [issue 28](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=28) created by ericr86 on 2012-07-10T21:39:59.000Z:

Take any gene annotation, run segtools-preproccess --annotation ANNOTATION, then use the .pkl output file in segtools-aggregation --mode gene. Get following error:

segtools.UnpickleError: Error: Cannot to load an indexed Annotation object as an indexed GeneAnnotation object.

I get this error in segtools 1.1.0 on RHEL 5.

I get this error in segtools 1.1.0 on RHEL 5.

values.title: segtools-signal-distribution does not detect nan entries .tab files

content.raw:
Original [issue 29](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=29) created by ericr86 on 2012-07-31T21:16:50.000Z:

Running segtools-signal-distribution using the -i option to load a tab file with nan entries causes the new tab file to have nan entries. This causes errors in R when plotting is attempted.

nan values may appear when comparing sequences with different chromosomes eg a sequence with a Y chromosome and a sequence without a Y chromosome.
content.html:
Original [issue 29](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=29) created by ericr86 on 2012-07-31T21:16:50.000Z:

Running segtools-signal-distribution using the -i option to load a tab file with nan entries causes the new tab file to have nan entries. This causes errors in R when plotting is attempted.

nan values may appear when comparing sequences with different chromosomes eg a sequence with a Y chromosome and a sequence without a Y chromosome.

values.title: Give segtools-signal-distribution trackname translation option.

content.raw:
Original [issue 30](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=30) created by ericr86 on 2012-07-31T22:42:21.000Z:

segtools-signal-distribution and segtools-gmtk-paramaters use the same plotting machinery to generate graphs. The --trackname-translation and --allow-regex options would be logical and practical additions to segtools-signal-distribution.
content.html:
Original [issue 30](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=30) created by ericr86 on 2012-07-31T22:42:21.000Z:

segtools-signal-distribution and segtools-gmtk-paramaters use the same plotting machinery to generate graphs. The --trackname-translation and --allow-regex options would be logical and practical additions to segtools-signal-distribution.

values.title: segtools-nucleotide-frequency prints unfriendly error message when Genomedata archive doesn't have sequence

content.raw:
Original [issue 31](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=31) created by ericr86 on 2012-09-11T21:47:28.000Z:

Attempted the command

segtools-nucleotide-frequency segway.bed.pkl.gz data/encode/commonData/byDataType/signal/jan2011/genomedata.tier1-2

get output:

values.title: segtools-transition fails to display label names.

content.raw:
Original [issue 32](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=32) created by ericr86 on 2012-10-18T23:48:38.000Z:

The graphs generated by segtools display segtools internal label numbering instead of the labels specified in the bed file.

Run "segtools-transition example.bed" with the attached example.bed and the graph generated will have numbers.
content.html:
Original issue 32 created by ericr86 on 2012-10-18T23:48:38.000Z:

The graphs generated by segtools display segtools internal label numbering instead of the labels specified in the bed file.

Run "segtools-transition example.bed" with the attached example.bed and the graph generated will have numbers.

values.title: problems after installing segtools

content.raw: Original [issue 33](https://code.google.com/p/segtools/issues/detail?id=33) created by ericr86 on 2015-02-24T01:37:04.000Z: What steps will reproduce the problem? I installed segtools after checking all the necessary packages of R and python. Also, I tested the PyTables installation and passed it. However, when I put a command line in ..../bin, I does not work at all... I got error messages like this: root@vm64-39:/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/bin# ./segtools-transition Traceback (most recent call last): File "./segtools-transition", line 5, in <module> from pkg_resources import load_entry_point File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/distribute-0.6.49-py2.7.egg/pkg_resources.py", line 2877, in <module> working_set.require(__requires__) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/distribute-0.6.49-py2.7.egg/pkg_resources.py", line 698, in require needed = self.resolve(parse_requirements(requirements)) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/distribute-0.6.49-py2.7.egg/pkg_resources.py", line 596, in resolve raise DistributionNotFound(req) pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: segtools==1.1.9 I use a sever from iPlant's atmosphere(this is a virtual machine) platform-specific files installed in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages new Python packages installed in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/lib/python2.7 new scripts and excutables installed in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/bin I installed segtools with root permission.. I could not understand the error messages... I attach some error message captured pix for your comfort plz help me!! ;) What is the expected output? What do you see instead? What version of the product are you using? On what operating system? Please provide any additional information below.
content.html:
Original issue 33 created by ericr86 on 2015-02-24T01:37:04.000Z:

<b>What steps will reproduce the problem?</b>

I installed segtools after checking all the necessary packages of R and python. Also, I tested the PyTables installation and passed it. However, when I put a command line in ..../bin, I does not work at all...

I got error messages like this:

root@vm64-39:/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/bin# ./segtools-transition Traceback (most recent call last): File "./segtools-transition", line 5, in <module> from pkg_resources import load_entry_point File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/distribute-0.6.49-py2.7.egg/pkg_resources.py", line 2877, in <module> working_set.require(requires) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/distribute-0.6.49-py2.7.egg/pkg_resources.py", line 698, in require needed = self.resolve(parse_requirements(requirements)) File "/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/distribute-0.6.49-py2.7.egg/pkg_resources.py", line 596, in resolve raise DistributionNotFound(req) pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: segtools==1.1.9

I use a sever from iPlant's atmosphere(this is a virtual machine) platform-specific files installed in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages new Python packages installed in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/lib/python2.7 new scripts and excutables installed in /usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/bin

I installed segtools with root permission..

I could not understand the error messages...

I attach some error message captured pix for your comfort plz help me!! ;)

<b>What is the expected output? What do you see instead?</b>

<b>What version of the product are you using? On what operating system?</b>

<b>Please provide any additional information below.</b>

values.title: signal-distribution not arcsinh transforming the data

content.html:
Line 112 in signal_distribution.py is missing the arcsinh function. It should be:

if transformation == "arcsinh":
                            seg_data_nonan = arcsinh((seg_data_nonan))

instead of

if transformation == "arcsinh":
                            seg_data_nonan = (seg_data_nonan)

values.title: Heatmap Plot Fail on segtools-overlap

content.raw:
This issue can be easily recreated using `segtools-overlap` with `-b segments` options with on any bed file and gtf file.

Sample Error Log:

```
#!
Plotting with R function: 'save.overlap.heatmap'
Error creating image: overlap/overlap.png. Error message: argument is not interpretable as logical
Error creating image: overlap/overlap.slide.png. Error message: argument is not interpretable as logical
Error creating image: overlap/overlap.pdf. Error message: argument is not interpretable as logical
Error creating image: overlap/overlap.thumb.png. Error message: argument is not interpretable as logical
Plotting completed in 0.1 seconds
Saving html data to file: overlap/overlap.div
```

This might be caused by the fact that in file `segtools/overlap.py` line 271 it send a `cluster = cluster` parameter to R, where the `cluster` here is mostly `False`. However, `save.overlap.heatmap` function does not support `cluster` option according to `segtools/R/overlap.R`. This might mess up the location of several parameter, casuing the `argument not interpretable as logical`. 

I tried to test my theory by removing the cluster option, the error is gone, but the resulting graph I get was incorrect. It might be the case that I modified something wrong, I will try modified and test it carefully tomorrow.
content.html:
This issue can be easily recreated using segtools-overlap with -b segments options with on any bed file and gtf file.

Sample Error Log:

Plotting with R function: 'save.overlap.heatmap'
Error creating image: overlap/overlap.png. Error message: argument is not interpretable as logical
Error creating image: overlap/overlap.slide.png. Error message: argument is not interpretable as logical
Error creating image: overlap/overlap.pdf. Error message: argument is not interpretable as logical
Error creating image: overlap/overlap.thumb.png. Error message: argument is not interpretable as logical
Plotting completed in 0.1 seconds
Saving html data to file: overlap/overlap.div

This might be caused by the fact that in file segtools/overlap.py line 271 it send a cluster = cluster parameter to R, where the cluster here is mostly False. However, save.overlap.heatmap function does not support cluster option according to segtools/R/overlap.R. This might mess up the location of several parameter, casuing the argument not interpretable as logical.

I tried to test my theory by removing the cluster option, the error is gone, but the resulting graph I get was incorrect. It might be the case that I modified something wrong, I will try modified and test it carefully tomorrow.

values.title: R Dependencies are not automatically installed

content.raw:
Currently R packages that segtools use (e.g. RColorBrewer) are not automatically installed.
There should be a way of installing these after a `pip install segtools`
content.html: Currently R packages that segtools use (e.g. RColorBrewer) are not automatically installed. There should be a way of installing these after a pip install segtools

values.title: Assertions caused by input should throw useful error messages

content.raw: Assertions should be delegated to detecting important internal errors. Any errors due to user input that are assertions should instead be changed to an error format that include a useful error message for the user.
content.html: Assertions should be delegated to detecting important internal errors. Any errors due to user input that are assertions should instead be changed to an error format that include a useful error message for the user.

values.title: casting issue w/ numpy > 1.10

content.raw:
Hello! segtools-aggregation fails with an error where mode is "gene" or "region". I temporarily implemented a workaround in my local version of segtools/aggregation.py: ``` #!python 446 res = empty(bin_starts_unrounded.shape, dtype="float") 447 round(bin_starts_unrounded, out=res) 448 res = res.astype(int) ``` Thanks. -- Arjan ``` #!python Traceback (most recent call last): File "mailto:michael.hoffman@utoronto.ca">michael.hoffman@utoronto.ca Sent: Monday, June 18, 2018 10:39 AM To: Maxwell Libbrecht Cc: Francis Nguyen; Winnie Xu Subject: Re: Comparing Segway runs

It's a good idea but I am thin on bandwidth for this. You want to upload these as part of a segtools feature request? At the very least it will make it easy for people to find it.

Michael

On Mon, Jun 18, 2018 at 1:34 PM Maxwell Libbrecht maxwell_libbrecht@sfu.ca wrote: Hi Francis,

I attached some scripts I wrote to do what you're asking for. overlap.py is the main script, which calls the others. The script (1) calls segtools-overlap to calculate the overlap between the annotations, (2) runs the Hungarian algorithm to calculate a mapping (stable marriage is also implemented and selectable using an option), (3) computes an ordering of the mapped labels so that high-overlap pairs appear close to each other using this algorithm, and (4) uses segtools-overlap to create a plot with the paired labels on the diagonal. Please let me know if you run into any problems using them.

Michael, I've been meaning for a while to try to get these incorporated into segtools. You would call segtools overlap --map (or something) to perform the matching and output the ordered plot (only valid for annotations with the same number of labels). If you find any bandwidth for this, it would be good to get it done.

Cheers, Max

From: Francis Nguyen fr.nguyen@mail.utoronto.ca Sent: Friday, June 15, 2018 11:35:40 AM To: Maxwell Libbrecht Cc: Winnie Xu Subject: Comparing Segway runs

Hello Dr. Libbrecht,

I was wondering if you had some script to compare different Segway runs? Something that would tie up one set of labels from one run to a set of labels from another. Dr. Hoffman described this as the Stable Marriage problem for Segway labels.

If so, we would be interested in using it for our current work with Segway. Could you let us know if you have something for this?

Thank you for your time, Francis Nguyen CC. Winnie Xu

values.title: segtools-relabel problem

content.raw:
Hi there,

When I run segtools-relabel to change labels. I met the following errors. Please help me out. Thanks! 


```
#!python
$ segtools-relabel U2OS_segway.layered.bed.gz U2OS_rename.mnemonics    
INFO:Loading Segmentation from file: U2OS_segway.layered.bed.gz
INFO:  Parsing lines from bed format
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/weiyanjia/anaconda2/bin/segtools-relabel", line 11, in <module>
    sys.exit(main())
  File "/Users/weiyanjia/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/relabel.py", line 130, in main
    relabel(*args, **kwargs)
  File "/Users/weiyanjia/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/relabel.py", line 40, in relabel
    segmentation = Segmentation(segfilename, verbose=verbose)
  File "/Users/weiyanjia/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/__init__.py", line 97, in __init__
    self._load(filename, verbose=verbose)
  File "/Users/weiyanjia/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/__init__.py", line 123, in _load
    self._from_file(filename, verbose=verbose)
  File "/Users/weiyanjia/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/segtools/__init__.py", line 351, in _from_file
    " in chromosome: %s" % chrom)
segtools.SegmentOverlapError: Found overlapping segments in chromosome: chrx

```

Besides, how could I extract different layers information from segway.layered.bed.gz file? I want to do comparison between different annotation files for each layer.

Weiyan
